description: Tim Berners-Lee writes a proposal called “Information Management.” It becomes the World Wide Web.
detail: A Supreme Court decision could fundamentally alter the regulation of speech on the internet.

description: The Dutch first use metal blades on ice skates. In the winter, their frozen canals became high-speed highways.
detail: Chicago's ice rink in Millennium Park was not as sturdy, melting in February because of the heat.

description: Soldiers mutiny against Congress in Philadelphia, seeking back pay. Lawmakers flee and decide to place the capital on federal land.
detail: Pennsylvania is planning a task force to prevent election intimidation and disruption.

description: Unhappy with the slow tempo, a music executive tries to stop Louis Armstrong from recording his next song: "What a Wonderful World."
detail: A new musical about Armstrong — called, yes, "A Wonderful World" — will debut on Broadway this fall.
